member_organisations:
42 organisations composed by sports societies and clubs which participate in the official football competitions at national level and of professional nature.  
 
More information can be found at www.laliga.es
fields_of_interest: Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Research and innovation, External Relations, Digital economy and society, Sport
eu_initiatives: LaLiga is interested and contributes with its experience and knowledge to European sports policy as well as to the audiovisual policy, competition policy, internal market policy and educational policy. Current most important files followed are: Communication on a Digital Single Market Strategy for Europe, Proposal for a Directive on the Audiovisual Media Services Directive, Proposal to modernise copyright rules and Proposal for a Regulation laying down rules on the exercise of copyright and related rights applicable to certain online transmissions of broadcasting organisations and retransmissions, and IPR Enforcement initiatives (Follow the Money).
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
European Professional Football Leagues Association (EPFL) 
 
Sport Rights Owners Coalition (SROC) 
 
Creativity Works! 
 
Sport Integrity Global Alliance (SIGA)
goals__remit: a) Organise and promote official football competitions at national level and ensuring their adequate functioning and b) Commercially exploit the competitions it organises within the limits established by the Sports Law and c) any other accessory or complementary activities related to the previous objectives.
